Mr. Shank, 9th grade Earth Science @ Methacton was ahead of his time (mid-1980s), emphasizing multidisciplinary studies to solve complex problems. I fell in love with geology, astronomy, oceanography, and meteorology. Meteorology won out. -Doug

I’ve had many great teachers, but Mr. Brown in honors physics and Ms. Schultz in honors chemistry at Omaha South High stand out. I loved going to class every day, experimenting and learning new things - especially when the Bunsen burner was involved. @ OPS_SouthHigh -Chris

Mr. Simonton, my 9th grade Earth Science teacher from @ MilanSchoolCorp fueled my existing passion for meteorology. He once excitedly showed me how much the atmospheric pressure had dropped on our recording barometer after a strong thunderstorm had passed over the school. -Corey

12th grade physics, Mr. Siskind @ hcpss_omhs. He showed me the power of math and physics as the basic foundation related to everything, was enthusiastic, inspirational, and made us feel as though we had the power to reach our goals. Most of all, he made physics fun! -Mary

Mr. Lewis, 6th grade science @ CCCSDtweets. He was never not excited about what he was teaching us, never met a laserdisc he didn’t like, and legend was you’d catch an eraser one way or another if you fell asleep... -Brian
It’s # WorldTeachersDay and we here in the NWS Communications Office can think of no better way to celebrate than to thank the teachers who influenced our careers as scientists...

You will also see/hear a test message on your TV & radio lasting about one minute. All messages will start with “THIS IS A TEST” and end with “No action is needed.” Find answers to Frequently Asked Questions and more information at http://fema.gov/emergency-alert-test …

The test is for a Presidential Alert, a type of Wireless Emergency Alert (WEA) only used for major emergencies that affect the entire country. This is the national version of WEA messages like AMBER & weather alerts from your local agencies.
You’ll get a message box on your phone with a tone & vibration. This is NOT a text and your phone number is NOT shared with anyone.
REMINDER Next Wednesday Oct. 3rd at 2:18 PM EDT, there will be a nationwide test of the Wireless Emergency Alert system. Share these 3 facts with your friends and family so they know what to expect:

Wednesday, Oct 3 at 2:18 pm EDT, there will be a national test of the Wireless Emergency Alert (WEA) system. A test message will be sent to cell phones connected to wireless providers participating in WEA. http://weather.gov/wrn/wea pic.twitter.com/It8aOsDBmL
